subject: Photography
title: Colonial Photography and the Gaze
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Colonial Photography and the Gaze.

hook.text: Colonial photographers documented 'exotic' peoples as specimens. The camera became a tool of domination.

buildup.text: In the 1800s, Western photographers traveled to colonies, framing indigenous people as curiosities or savages.

discovery.text: The concept of 'the gaze' describes how the photographer's viewpoint imposes power over the subject.

twist.text: These images shaped Western perceptions for generations. The damage of a biased photograph outlasts the photographer.

climax.text: Modern photo ethics require awareness of power dynamics between photographer and subject ‚Äî especially across cultures.

punchline.text: Every photograph has a point of view. Not all are honest.

quiz.question: What does 'the gaze' describe in photography theory?
options: How the photographer's viewpoint imposes power dynamics over the subject
The way subjects look at the camera
